item.title: Ansible: Setting up WordPress
item.description: 08/25/2022 1. Create droplet in DigitalOcean Select an Ubuntu 20.04LTS droplet Go with the cheapest rate to get started and upgrade later Datacenter - SF3 Add SSH keys Enable Monitoring Set an accurate hostname - ie: casat.org, or dev.casat.org. Do not use names like ‘Tamale’ or ‘WordPress’. The hostname set here will be referenced by Ansible later and setting to something other than the Domain name can cause issues later on.

item.title: Ansible: Staging to live
item.description: 08/24/22 These are the steps for Taking a WordPress website from staging, or ‘dev’, to live using Ansible. 1. Snapshots In the DigitalOcean interface create ‘pre-migration’ snapshots of both the current ‘live’ server (soon to become the deprecated server) and the staging server 2. Update URL information on Staging Edit the Apache virtual host file (should be: /etc/apache2/sites-available/wordpress.conf) to reflect the actual URL in non-HTTPS (ie: http://casat.

item.title: Bash: Migrating WordPress
item.description: 10/19/2021 Copying the data Exporting the data Importing the data Updating the URL in the database Updating the URL with wp-cli Updating the URL with MySql When migrating a WordPress website from one server/VPS to another there are two things we need to make sure we capture; the MySql database and the wp-content folder. The instructions below will walkthrough copying both the MySql database and the wp-content folders from an existing WordPress installation to another ‘blank’ WordPress installation on a different VPS.
